benchmark_details.name: Codec-SUPERB
benchmark_details.overview: The Codec-SUPERB challenge is designed to facilitate fair and lightweight comparisons among existing neural audio codec models, providing a platform to analyze the quality of audio resynthesized from various codec models using representative speech applications and objective metrics.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a lightweight and efficient benchmark for evaluating neural audio codecs on various speech applications and objective metrics.

data.source: Curated from license-free datasets like Librispeech, VoxCeleb1, and others for evaluating codec performance.
data.size: Varies with a random sample for evaluations.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on resynthesized audio and compared to reference values.
methodology.interpretation: Lower WER and EER indicate better performance in preserving audio quality.
methodology.baseline_results: Compared various codec models, including a pioneering model, Encodec.
methodology.validation: Evaluation pipeline is training-free and designed to yield quick preliminary results.
